I agree with much of what you say.

I would like to differentiate between J=
2EE and EJB's, which I think is what you are really refering to. EJB's are =
an as yet immature technology, in much the same way that JSP was when it fi=
rst came out. Given a few more years and much cogitation, I'm sure that the=
y can be fixed or replaced with something better.

I saw in a recent report=
 on the SD conference that Scott Ambler led a panel discussion where the en=
tire panel (including a Sun engineer) expressed disappointment with Entity =
EJB's.

I remember being really excited when I first heard of EJBs, but the=
 more I try to learn about them, the more I find myself shying away from th=
em.

Simon
